snippet: Hazem Salah Abu Ismail’s old-school Islamism conflicts with the pragmatic politics of the Muslim Brotherhood, which is fielding its own Egyptian presidential candidate.
abstract: Hazem Salah Abu Ismail is frontrunner in race to become Egypt's next president, raising prospect that winner may not be a more secular or liberal figure; Abu is strident Islamist who opposes Muslim Brotherhood's pragmatic focus on stable relations with the United States and Israel and free-market economics.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Steven Lee Myers from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Hazem Salah Abu Ismail’s old-school Islamism conflicts with the pragmatic politics of the Muslim Brotherhood, which is fielding its own Egyptian presidential candidate.

headline.seo: Attacking the West, Islamist Gains in Egypt Presidential Bid
headline.main: In Egyptian Hard-Liner’s Surge, New Worries for the Muslim Brotherhood
headline.print_headline: In Egyptian Hard-Liner’s Surge, New Worries for the Muslim Brotherhood
